## Axolotls: Mexico's Amazing Aquatic Salamander

Axolotls are unique salamanders from Mexico that never fully grow up. They stay small and aquatic, keeping their gills and youthful features even when they're adults.  They were once found in lakes near Mexico City, but their homes were destroyed, and now they're critically endangered. Pollution, invasive species, and loss of habitat are threatening their survival. Axolotls are important to scientists because they can regrow lost body parts, even parts of their heart!
